dialogues.text: (on tape) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape) On tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape) If I can't do it all, I don't want to do anything. And I can't do it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape) Can't or won't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. John is still watching the tape, his face betray no emotion. Graham still listens from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The previous afternoon. We are no longer looking at Ann o monitor, but watching her and Graham AS THEY MADE THE TAP instance, we can now see Graham from Ann's point of view, two of them at the same time, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you weren't always impotent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you have had sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was the last person you had sex with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name was Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened? Was it so bad that it turned you off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was wonderful. That wasn't the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem was me. I was...I was a pathological liar. Or am, I should say. Lying is like alcoholism, one is always "recovering".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you lied to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I did. Willfully and repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved her for how good she made me feel, and I hated her for how good she made me feel. And at that time, I tended to express my feelings non-verbally. I couldn't handle anyone having that much control over my emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I make sure that no one has the opportunity to test me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get lonely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I, with all these nice people stopping by? The fact is that I've lived by myself for so long, I can't imagine living with another person. It's amazing what you can get used to if enough time goes by. And anyway, I'm asking the questions. Are you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anymore. I thought  I was, but obviously I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you confront John with the fact that you knew about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. I'm not sure I will. I just want out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do get out of your marriage, will you continue to be inhibited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It all gets back to that Cynthia thing. I don't like her...eagerness. There's nothing left to imagine, there's no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subtlety?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subtlety, yes. No subtlety. Plus, I've never really felt able to open up with anyone. I mean, that other person I told you about, I enjoyed making love with him a lot, but I still wasn't able to really let go. I always feel like I'm being watched and I shouldn't embarrass myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you feel the same way with John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of. I mean, John's like this kind of...craftsman. Like he's a carpenter, and he makes really good tables. But that's all he can make, and I don't need anymore tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting analogy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm babbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) God, I m so mad at him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be. He lied to you. So did Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, but somehow I expect that from her, I mean, she'll do it with almost anybody, I don't know, I shouldn't stick up for her I guess, but him. He lied so...deeply!! Ooo, I want to watch him die!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann sits quietly for a moment. Graham watches her silentl The camera continues to roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up at Graham) You're really never going to make love again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not planning on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were in love with me, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I can't answer that precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I feel like maybe I could be really comfortable with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very flattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why won't you make love with me? Why wouldn't you, I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann. Are you asking me hypothetically, or are you asking me for real, right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking for real. I want you to turn that camera off and make love with me. Will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't understand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann, it could happen to me all over again, don't you see? I could start to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how do you know for sure, you have to try to find a way to fig--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't face her if I had slept with somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you're still in contact with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're planning to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Possibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute. What's going on here? Did you come back here just to see her again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was part of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like maybe a big part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham, I mean, what do you think her reaction is going to be if you contact her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you, look at what's happened to you, look how you've changed! Don't you think she will have changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I really would rather not talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has to laugh) Whoa!! I'm so glad we got that on tape!! You won't answer a question about Elizabeth, but I have to answer all these intimate questions about my sex life!! Graham, what do you think she's going to make of all these videotapes? Are you going to tell her about them? I can't imagine her being too understanding about that. But since you don't lie anymore, you'll have to say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said, I haven't decided what to do, exactly. Perhaps I won't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you just moved here to think about it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham says nothing. Ann looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Graham, this is so...pathetic. You're not even what you pretend to be, you're a lie, you're a bigger lie than you ever were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham sets the camera down, though it continues to recor He is visibly upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you want to talk about lies, let's talk about lies, Ann. Let's talk about lying to yourself. You haven't been able to sleep with your husband because you're no longer in love with him, and maybe you never were. You haven't been honest with yourself in longer than you can remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heated) Yeah, you're right. But I never claimed to know everything like  you, and have all these little theories. I'm still learning, I know that. But I don't feel like I've wasted time. If I had to go through my marriage to get to where I am right now, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann moves in closer, burrowing, her eyes on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you. You have wasted nine years. I mean, that has to be some sort of weird record or something, nine years. How does that feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham says nothing. Ann picks up the camera and points i him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Because"? That's not good enough. I asked you a question, Graham. I asked you "how does it feel"? How does it feel, Mr. I Want To Go Down On You But I Can't? Do you know how many people you've sucked into your weird little world? Including me? Come on, how does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just going to keep asking until you answer. I'm sure there's plenty of tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't find this "turning the tables" thing very interesting--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham reaches up for the camera. Ann knocks his hand awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until I get some answers. Tell what you feel. Not what you think, I've heard plenty of that. What you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham is on the verge of completely falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right!! All right!! You want to know? You want to know how I feel? I feel ashamed. Is that what you wanted to hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. Graham regains his composure somewhat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you ashamed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Ann. Why is anybody anything? I think you have this idea that people are either all good or all bad, and you don't allow for any gray areas, and that's what most of us consist of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not answering me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heated) Well, what kind of answer are you looking for, Ann? What is it exactly that you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know why you are the way you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm telling you it's not any one thing that I can point to and say "That's why!" It doesn't work that way with people who have problems, Ann, it's not that neat, it's not that tidy! It's not a series of little boxes that you can line up and count. Things just don't happen that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why can't you just put it all behind you? Can't you just forget it? All that stuff you did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Ann, I can't. I can't forget it. It's not something I can fix. It's difficult. There s something in my mind...the way my brain works... [frustrated) God, Ann, when you're with another person, and you re...inside them, you're so vulnerable, you're revealing so much...there's no protection. And...somebody could say, or do something to you while you re in this...state of...nakedness. And they could hurt you without even knowing it. In a way that you couldn't even see. (looks at Ann) And you would withdraw. To make sure it didn't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann looks at him for a long moment and then sets the came down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves in front of Graham and kneels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to touch you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to touch you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann reaches out, and Graham instinctively begins to move

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in her voice makes him stop. Their eyes lock. G slowly moves back toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann's hand eases out to him, her eyes still burning into Graham closes his eyes, accepting Ann's touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She caresses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delicately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches his arms, his face, his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing her eyes, she takes his hand and puts it against face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to lie him back on the couch. When he offers l resistance, she gently persists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham lies back, silently obeying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gradually, her hand slips to his neck and she begins to  unbutton his shirt. She watches his face, hoping that he remain calm. He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rubs her hand on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again she brings Graham's hand to her face. She move hand to her neck and throat, painting her skin with his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon each hand is exploring the other. Fingers search for find hidden areas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their hands remain together, and Graham's eyes remain clo Ann moves onto the couch with Graham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gently lowers herself into a sitting position on his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly moves both of her hands onto Graham's chest. T move forward and back, like a lazy tide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Graham. His face is tranquil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann quietly begins to move her face toward his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon she is hovering inches above him, her long hair touc his features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lowers her lips to his forehead and kisses him. She w for a negative reaction. Getting none, she moves lower an kisses his eyes. Still receiving no discouragement, she m to his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A subtle movement from Graham. Ann waits for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She then moves to his lips, her luxuriant tresses envelop his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham tilts his head back and she softly kisses his neck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham's hands make their way up Ann's back until they ha reached her neck. He slowly pulls his face to hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham is flooded with warmth and excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He caresses her, intoxicating himself with physical conta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kisses become more meaningful, and the touching becom more passionate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Graham seems about to evaporate in a state ecstasy, his eyes filled with relief and happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But his gaze happens to fall on the video camera, which continues to record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham seizes up and abruptly backs away from Ann's embra Reality slowly envelopes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann reaches for his hand. He allows her to take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost dazed) It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham looks at Ann for a long moment. She sees the accep and gratitude in his eyes. She smiles lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham moves forward and shuts off the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John watching the tape. There is video snow on the monito The tape timer reads 46:02. John gets up slowly, ejects t from the player, and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham, hearing the footsteps approach, backs away from t inlet. His eye is swollen, and he holds one of his hands a curious position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John opens the door. He looks at Graham for a moment befo reaching into his pocket for Graham's keys. He dangles th in his hand as he stands over Graham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never told you this, because I thought it would crush you, but now I could give a shit. (pause) I fucked Elizabeth. Before you broke up. Before you were having trouble, even. So you can stop making her into a saint. She was good in bed and she could keep a secret. And that's about all I can say about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drops Graham's keys to the floor and leaves. Graham fighting back tears, and walks into his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls Ann's tape from the videotape player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches inside the cassette cartridge and pulls the vi itself out, ruining it forever. He does the same to every tape in both the boxes. Calmly. Deliberately. Methodicall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to the camera/recorder, trailing a mound of videotape behind him. He breaks the lens off the camera b and smashes the inner workings against the edge of the ta He then drops the damaged unit into the pile of destroyed where it disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Millaney talks to his colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, not having to answer to anybody... I feel like this huge weight has been lifted from my shoulders. I mean, come on, if I decide that I'd rather live alone, what's so bad about that? It's not like I've decided to live a life of crime, right? It's just how I feel, you can't help the way you feel, you just have to be honest about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John dials a number on his telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IBM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone) Brian Kirkland, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask who's calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Millaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his colleague) Anyway, I've always said, the work is the thing. I can be happy without a marriage, but take away my work, that's different. And if Ann can't handle that, that's her problem, like we re all alone in this world, you know what I'm saying? I mean, fuck. (looks at phone) Jesus, what's takin' this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intercom clicks to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on speaker) Mr. Millaney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on speaker) Mr. Forman would like to see you in his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, in a minute, I'm on with a client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on speaker) He said immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intercom clicks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Millaney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kirkland has asked me to inform you that he has obtained legal representation elsewhere, and that if you have a message for him to leave it with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I...there is no message. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hangs up. He thinks for a moment, rubbing his forehe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intercom clicks to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on speaker) Mr. Millaney, Mr. Forman is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over) Come on, I'm not asking too much, am I? Just one little question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is tending bar. The Dude from earlier is still th puffing On a big cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me what time you get off. Work, I mean. What's the harm in that? Whaddaya say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann enters the lounge. Cynthia watches with apprehensive surprise as Ann approaches with a potted plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dude) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia moves to meet Ann at the end of the bar. Ann sets plant down on the counter. Her manner is diffident, but n hostile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's your birthday, and I know you like plants. So I got you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is very moved, though she struggles valiantly to her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I can't stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann begins to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann turns back to face her. They look at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have my work number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann writes the number down on a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get real busy between two and four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann looks at Cynthia again before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann leaves. Cynthia continues to look at the door long af Ann has left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Don't come in here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham sits reading. There is now some furniture in the apartment. Bookshelves, plants, etc. There are periodical the table where the video gear used to be. There are no cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a knock at Graham's door, which now has a deadbo lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock again. Graham sets his book down and goes to the He unlocks the deadbolt and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann stands in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham is obviously flushed with feeling at seeing her. S wordlessly moves into the room, her movements like a slow breeze, her expression calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham watches her go by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops in the middle of the room, her back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham moves toward her slowly. Sensing him behind her, h breathing becomes deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham slowly enfolds her in his arms, his face against h hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes as their fingers entwine.
